page.title: 11SHEEP FARMING.
page.content: A typical sheep farm in this area rears about 1400 sheep on 450 acres. Two recommended breeds for this type of land are Swaledale & Blue Face Leicester.Lambing generally takes place in April & of course is very dependant on the weather.This year, because of a very poor spring & summer the lambing has not been very good.The average per ewe is 1.5 lambs.Shearing takes place at the end of June & early July.It is mainly done by electric shears but on one or two farms is still done by hand.Fleeces are sold in summer & the sheep in autumn.Often farms are run without any outside help.Since the entry of the U.K.into the E.E.C.there has been a slight beneficial effect in the form of subsidies.
